Reviews.Title: “Would definitely use again!”
Reviews.Author: vrtw
Reviews.Content: My husband and i were visiting Venice for my birthday and i was very happy with this choice of hotel. The location is excellent, not even 5 minutes from the Rialto bridge (also convenient when coming in with a water bus) and again not 5 minutes from San Marco square in the other direction. Check in and check out both went smoothly and all enquiries posed to the staff were handled quickly and courteously. We had a deluxe canal facing the canal which was spacious with a large bathroom. I liked that extra bedding and pillows were provided because i normally always have to request this at hotels. The beds were very good. There is no iron in the room. One night reception arranged for my dress to be ironed but it cost â‚¬8, so rather iron at home or travel with wrinkle free clothes. We booked a speacial romantic arrangement which included breakfast in bed, prosecco, and tickets to the casino..definitely worth it..we spent an enjoyable evening at the casino although without the tickets i am not 100% sure we would have made the effort. The only 1 let down was that one morning our breakfast in bed order was not collected and only after 10 minutes of waiting we looked outside and realized this. I called reception and they immediately sent someone over and we got out breakfast very quickly. I think how a hotel responds when something goes wrong says alot. The water is not drinkable but i would advise getting water for brushing your teeth etc outside the hotel. We paid â‚¬5 for 750ml in te hotel and â‚¬1,50 for 1,5l at a normal shop. All in all i would definitely use this hotel if i have the pleasure to visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kiki b
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time in Venice ,you have also contributed to it. The hotel has an excellent location, beautiful rooms , it is a real value for the money,best breakfast I had in a hotel so far. The last star is missing , because the room was cold and I had to ask you twice to heat it up. That was really just a little and insignificant detail everything else was very good. Thank you Bella Venezia

Reviews.Title: “bella bella!”
Reviews.Author: richieblue1
Reviews.Content: Well, we booked this hotel, but ended up in the annexe "scala". see my review "hidden gem" scala hotel. Although we were moved to scala, we spent most of our time in this hotel and cant praise it enough. This is a true 4 star hotel. The reception staff are great and helpful in every way. Excellent, reception area with bar, but the crowning glory is the breakfast. Bacon and fluffy scrambled egg, with toast , or if you preffer, cereals, hot croissants, fresh fruit and juices, tea and coffee, cakes pastries and yoghurts plus more and if up early, a table with view of the canal. Cant comment on rooms as we were in annexe but they looked lovely. This hotel is 2 mins to rialto one way and 5 mins the other to st marks square, perfect, and passing lovely shops, resteaurants, and views on way, all in all would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Easy to reach from Rialto Bridge and very easy walking from hotel to St Mark's Square and other wonderful sites. Very professional and friendly service. Hotel rooms large and very comfortable. The bathroom was large. Breakfast was lovely and extensive. No tea / coffee making facilities. Is pretty expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and beautiful views!”
Reviews.Author: Franger28
Reviews.Content: I originally booked another hotel but was upgraded to this one instead due to a problem with the door. The bellman arrived and took our luggage with us to this hotel instead. When we first arrived the first thing we noticed was the amazing view from the window. We had room 307 which was on the highest floor of their hotel and could see a gorgeous view of the canal and gondolas passing by. The room and bathroom was decent sized and the decor was just right. A bit of old charm but not too old that its eery. The bed and pillows were amazingly comfortable,so good that we wanted to sleep all day! Though i found an ant each day on the bed it didn't really bother me too much.The hairdryer included looks like a vacuum cleaner attached to the wall, it wasn't the best and the shower was a bit small.We also had another window in the bathroom that overlooked the roofs of adjacent buildings.American buffet breakfast was included and it wasn't great but you could dine at a window next to the canal and the view was great.The hotel also has a bar at the front reception area.Location was about halfway between San Marco square and Rialto bridge.We found it very convenient to get around and explore.Staff at the hotel did the bare minimum,when we had a problem with our remote for the TV the man who came to fix it wasn't too happy.I wouldn't say they were helpful at all when we enquired about tours so we just decided to go out on our own. Free wifi was included but you need a password from the staff. All in all I loved this hotel, it was everything that I wanted in Venice and I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: anna12321
Reviews.Content: My room had a few dents in the floor that weren't repaired, bad service staff who didn't know anything to do with train schedules, free internet and printing, GREAT breakfeast! Good location 3minutes walk to both san marco and Rialto!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cdnlindaloo
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in an excellent location, directly down from the water taxi and basically straight from St. Marks square. It was bright, clean and although the elevator is not large, it was perfectly adequate. Good breakfast included. Delicious pizza right across the narrow street from the entrance. Lots of reasonably priced shops on the route to St. Marks Square. Clean, quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: hille96
Reviews.Content: For a 4-star hotel, there were a few drawbacks: the room was terribly small, the lobby seemed uninviting and the staff at the reception was not too helpful. However, the breakfast was very good and the service in the breakfast room very friendly. There was a bar in the lobby, but no service. Once we asked for a cup of coffee but there was no one to serve it. The weather was hot, so it would have been nice to sit down in the air-conditioned lobby after returning from the crowded streets. The location was good if you want to be in the middle of the tourist areas of Rialto and San Marco. It only took 5 minutes to reach the waterbus terminals at Rialto. In the otherwise nicely decorated room, there was only one hard chair by the desk, so there was practically nowhere to sit except on the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading advertising”
Reviews.Author: trish1CorkIreland
Reviews.Content: I booked this room with booking.com. When I booked the room I saw it mentioned an annex. I didnt think this meant a completely different hotel. When we arrived we were taken to Palazzo la Scala. All the photos on the website are for the main building Hotel Bella Venezia. While we were there, we heard of 3 other groups complaining of the same thing. They have now amended the website but it felt like I'd been scammed at the time. The room at Palazzo la Scala is tiny. There's enough room for a double bed & 2 bedside lockers & that's the total width. The bed & a narrow wardrobe fills its length with a narrow walkway to the bathroom. Its maybe a 2 star operation & this is coming from someone who usually stays in hostels not hotels. We never saw anyone on reception at Palazzo la Scala. The breakfast was nice & the hotel is in a good location but the whole experience could have been avoided by the hotel advertising the hotels seperately!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: steppewolf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good located (5 minutes from Rialto Bridge and 10 minutes from San Marco Place. We booked on line 2 rooms, one for the parents and one for our daughter. It was only after the confirmation that we were informed that the room of our daughter was located in an annex building (150 metres from the main building). She got a very small room, where the airco didn't function. The staff in the restaurant (breakfast) was unfriendly. I regret that I didn'nt consult TripAdvisor before the booking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: PhilDuff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here once before in 2007 just after the hotel had been refurbished so knew what to expect. 17th century outside but 21st century inside. Located about half way between St.Marks Square and the Rialto Bridge so ideal for exploring Venice. Nice rooms with all modern facilities and reasonably priced for Venice, especially if you book and pay in advance. Nice breakfast and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Which Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: alruttle
Reviews.Content: booked the room through Trivago.com as Hotel Belle Venezia. On receiving my booking confirmation it stated I had booked Hotel La Scarla. I didnt think anything of it at first as it appeared on my credit card bill as I thought it was just a different trading name. On arriving at the Hotel and checking, in the porter then to our surprise wheeled our cases out the hotel and down the street to the aforementioned La scarla rooms. These were no way up to 4 star standard and the bed looked like it had been shoehorned into the room. Also the air conditioning although very effective had a habit of turning on every 20 seconds after I had turned it off. So be prepared for an icy night if you get room 201. We shared facilities with or pike dream hotel of which we found offered a good breakfast and had friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place in a Charming City”
Reviews.Author: sssster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Late June and early July. Fairly recently remodeled - and they did a great job. Very nice decor in the lobby and the rooms. Very comfortable beds. Clean rooms and spot on housekeeping service. Limited number of English language stations on the TV - but you're not in Venice to watch TV, are you? Breakfast is lovely. Staff here are very friendly and never let on if they felt any annoyance with us. Always a smile and always helpful with suggestions for attractions or dining. The hotel is nicely located between the Rialto Bridge and San Marco Piazza. From here it's easy to get to almost anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Never been so humiliated in my life”
Reviews.Author: BernardoJoppert
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 days last may. First when we went down for breakfast, the hotel lady ask me if we were hotel guests ... After the checkout we spent the day at Venice. In the end of the day we went back to get the luggage to go to the railway station. By that time the recepcionist ask me if we have robbed the bath robe from the hotel room !!!!!!!!! That`s definitely unbelivelible humialiation ! I dont recommend this hotel to anyone ! Its not only about how fancy the hotel is but how good the service is ! And definitely this hotel service is the worse service i've ever had !

Reviews.Title: “Bella Venezia booked through Otel.com”
Reviews.Author: VictoryHo
Reviews.Content: I booked through otel.com and was led to believe that I was reserving a room at Bella Venezia. It turns out that the reservation was at La Scala in a different hotel of much lower quality. Even though my confirmation said HOTEL : Dependance Bella Venezia (La Scala) Hotel (Centre), this is misleading. I selected Bella Venezia from the choices\links on otel.com not La Scala. All the pictures that I saw were of Bella Venezia. Customer service at Otel.com was polite but not helpful. They were interested in closing my query instead of resolving it. I would be very careful when booking a room through this site. Because you may not get what you paid for. Staff at Bella Venezia was also not helpful at all.

Reviews.Title: “Dour cold front desk. nice room and location”
Reviews.Author: CintiKidCincinnati
Reviews.Content: Compared to the warm, friendly personnel at our previous hotel in Venice, the front desk at this hotel was cold and unfriendly. Request for even 1/2 hour late check out was flatly denied, as was request for early check-in also flatly denied. The high speed internet station did not function. The room was spacious and the location excellent. but for enjoying Venice, avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience at this hotel and it is in a good location too.”
Reviews.Author: CameronTwells
Reviews.Content: We booked and pre-paid for a "standard" room and were given a "superior" upgrade on arrival. The room was large (for a city hotel) and had a very big bathroom. All was clean and tidy but we had no view other than another side of the hotel. The room was very quiet and the air-con worked well. Breakfast was good with great pastries but the coffee was from a machine and tasted of chemicals, this was the only negative thing we could think of. Overall we found the Bella Venezia to be very comfortable and the staff to be pleasant andhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: Labird057
Reviews.Content: This is a horrible place to stay. The staff is rude. When I was waiting to check in the two parties ahead of me were complaining that they were sold something other than they were assured of. Very dishonest hotel. I was sold what I thought a deluxe room that I pre paid, and was given a standard room with a view of a wall. Avoid this hotel at all costs, they are using a good location in the city to suck you in and take your money. The staff is dishonest and will honor nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Asked For Better Accomodations For The Price”
Reviews.Author: Pineguy
Reviews.Content: My grown daughter and I stayed for three nights after reading the reviews here. I picked it for the breakfast, location and price. I was not disappointed. It fully lived up to its advertising. We had one minor hitch: when we arrived were were put in a room with a double bed, even though we specified twin beds. The clerk moved us to an upgraded room at no additional charge as there were no other rooms available. The breakfasts were outstanding and plentiful with a good view of a canal. I don't understand why they won't let you take a piece of fruit to your room, though. We joked about the "fruit police" catching us. We paid $104 a night for three nights, booking four months early and with no refund on cancellation. The bath robes were a nice touch. The central location made it easy to go back to the hotel when we needed a bathroom. The street it is on goes from St. Mark's Square to the Grand Canal, just below the Rialto Bridge, making it easy to navigate around. We avoided paying the Internet fee by walking the side streets with an iPhone and using personal hot spots that weren't password protected. There were many. There's a good Gelato place about 2 mins from the hotel toward St. Marks. Order the small size. It comes with two large scoops of whatever flavor you want. We actually walked to the bus stop when we left, since it was quite early. It .took us 35 minutes with one suitcase each and stopping to take photos of the empty streets. I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel .... but”
Reviews.Author: LadyWard1
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, clean, and well appointed rooms, beds very comfortable. Breakfast FAB! I booked through a website, advertising Romantic Venice Break for an unbeatable price which gave you a superior room, bottle of wine on arrival and also breakfast in room, free entry to casino. On arrival was greeted with a miserable male receptionist who 'huffed and puffed' as he checked us in. The room fine (later to discover was only a deluxe room), and there was no wine on arrival or the offer of breakfast in your room ... we did not want to moan and complain, as the room we had was fine and we were on holiday. Complained when we got back from Venice. The hotel is very well situated and try the italian restaurant 3 doors down, great. I would recommend the hotel due to location and it's cleanliness and nice furnishings, however, the front of house desk people (men and women) do need lessons in being friendly, it costs nothing to smile. Also, they should never advertise things they cannot deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: laura_luna1223
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first 3 days of our trip to Italy in this hotel. Our room was beautifuly furnished and very clean and our bed had the most confortable matress we have ever slept in. The staff was friendly and helpful. The people at the reception desk gave us advice and tips any time we asked. The location of this hotel is very close to main points of interest such as the Rialto and the Piazza San Marco. The breakfast choice was very good. I would recommend this hotel anytime.

Reviews.Title: “way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: StaLuc
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel claiming to be something else. Everything about it was average compared to the impression given online and the prices. Waste of money. Stay somewhere else for these prices.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venetian week-end”
Reviews.Author: Tiennetti
Reviews.Content: I've been at Bella Venezia with a "Romantic WeekEnd Package" including 2 nights and one Champane Bottle. The hotel is very well situated, very clean. We had a room just on the channel, with a very nice "wood and bricks" top. The staff was very kind at all time and willing to help. The breakfast was astonishing, served at the room in just 15minutes with lot of variety and very good italian pastry and products. They should however change that orange juice for a natural one Very recomended

Reviews.Title: “Do not prepay!”
Reviews.Author: LouIse H
Reviews.Content: We made the mistake of prepaying for our room. When we arrived, we were told there were â€™technical difficultiesâ€™ with our room (whatever that means...) and we had to drag our luggage through the streets to find the replacement hotel they had arranged. I donâ€™t know what technical difficulties could have prevented them from giving us our room, and I suspect they double booked it. The staff were not even apologetic about it. The other hotel did not have internet access, and we were only given a small breakfast in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and an upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: NikEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Bella Venezia on the first leg of our Italian tour. We were slightly concerned when we were told on arrival that we were being upgraded to the luxury apartment situated around the corner. Any fears we had were soon put to rest when we saw the apartment, it consisted of two double bedrooms, living room with flat screen TV and a large bathroom all tastefully decorated to a high standard with air con throughout with the addition of unlimited use of a laptop. The apartment also overlooked a small courtyard which was very quiet at night. The location of both hotel and apartment are ideal for exploring and close to all of the sights. The reception staff were very helpful and dealt with our only minor problem quickly and efficiently, breakfast as taken in a bright room overlooking a canal and was served by friendly welcoming staff. Our Bella Vevezia experience added greatly to our Venice stay and was a welcome haven from the busy streets of the city.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1girlintheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend this summer in Bella Venezia. We took the directions from one of the reviews and they were quite accurate IF you get off at the right stop on the water bus. Keep in mind there is more than one Rialto stop so be sure to get off at the main one. The hotel was great. Our room was a decent size, furnishings were in good condition and everything was neat and clean. The breakfast was adequate and exactly what you get at most European hotels (pastries, yogurt, cold cuts, etc.) with the addition of eggs. The house-made chocolate croissants were served warm and were a nice treat. They only seem to staff one person at the front desk at a time so it could mean waiting quite a while to ask a question, but that was our only complaint and really not even a complaint. Perhaps just a suggestion to accommodate guests better. Location is great and very close to Rialto and the water bus stop. Highly recommend as it is a great value for a much more affordable price than most in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venezia!”
Reviews.Author: SheilaHnSeattle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely and sophisticated with lovely rooms and great air conditioning. The staff is helpful and friendly and was an oasis to return to after a perfect day of walking and exploring Venice. The hotel is well situated in that it is easy to find your way back to it from either the Rialto or San Marcos. For anyone who has traveled to Venice, you will know there are always signs to these two places and as such are the only two places you can be truly guaranteed to find. Its nice to have a hotel located between the two when you wander as far afield as we do. Getting lost is part of the fun if you know you can always figure out a way back. Also, the hotel serves a very nice breakfast each morning and is a nice way to start the day. We will definitely return to this hotel when we get back to Venice. I hope it is very, very soon!!

Reviews.Title: “mediocre hotel staffed by buffoons”
Reviews.Author: KennyLetter
Reviews.Content: Venice is notoriously expensive even for those accustomed to 5* London West End accommodation so I suspect that poor value must be tolerated for the sake of a good location in such a beautiful city. Reception staff, however, looked like buffoons when they told us on behalf of the manager that we had to sign a 'declaration' that we were satisfied with our accommodation. Would you sign? We didn't because: (1) We had booked with lastminute as a topsecret hotel, which provided a discount but not a vast one. What we got on arrival was a suite on the first floor of a building 100 metres away. Access to our room door could be obtained by any passerby through the unlocked front door of the building and by entry through a permanently open 'security' door which the hotel knew was broken but didn't fix. The accommodation was therefore insecure. Reaching it up a flight of stairs open to the public without staff present made it potentially dangerous for women travellers; (2) The suite, although beautifully furnished and decorated, attracted numerous mosquitoes even with windows closed. The hotel had to be asked to place a device in a plug socket to reduce their number. Why wasn't this already in the room? It might have saved me the trouble of hunting them through the night after being bitten every few hours; (3) Breakfast was, as a previous reviewer warned, mediocre. Particularly cheap touches included taking away the fresh orange juice machine & providing the lowest quality fare; (4) We were told that it is illegal to use an iron in your room. The hotel wanted 20 euros to iron a dress. Does anyone else believe that ironing your own clothes is a criminal offence? (5) We asked for an alternative room and were shown a cramped, stuffy one on the third floor only minutes after the reception staff had falsely and preposterously insisted that a fire had closed it off. When we declined this even worse alternative one staff member insisted that this was the only option as we had 'refused all others', only to change his mind after a few minutes. His superior then shouted at him for allowing us not to accept the third floor room and tried, unsuccessfully, to insist that we take it. I am a lifelong fan of slapstick buffoonery but would rather have seen it on stage at a fraction of the price we paid for it here. Moral: go to beautiful, sleepy Venice with mosquito repellent. See it all within three enjoyable days. Don't stay here unless paid for by someone else who does not care about value, service or quality.

Reviews.Title: “Too Good to be true !”
Reviews.Author: threeline
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel, brilliant location right in the centre of San Marco. Room was very comfortable. Breakfast was excellent in a beautiful room with Gondolas passing the window. I can't praise this Hotel enough and we are very regular travellers to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: missemmz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the bella venezia at the beginning of April, this was our first visit to Venice and I read all the hotel reviews before I went. As described this hotel is in a perfect location, two minutes from Rialto bridge and St Marks square. The rooms were of a fair size, we didnt get a view at all, just an inside wall, but there were shutters on the windows and black out curtains, which meant we had some really good nights sleep. The American breakfast consisted of cheese, ham, toast, croissants, scrambled eggs, frankfurt sausage, fruit and yoghurt. Which wasn't bad at all, but dont go expecting a full cooked breakfast, cause you will be dissappointed. The reception staff, as all the staff in Venice were quite rude and expressionless. We didnt like the way someone had to check our room before we were allowed to leave! Apart from that go for the location, but search around to get a good deal on the rate.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to meet thoroughly rude staff, this is the place.”
Reviews.Author: VMTraveller
Reviews.Content: I popped in to ask the price of rooms for future reference. They refused to tell me and were very arrogant and highly unpleasant about it. When my husband asked if they were always that rude to ladies, they said they would call the police. He remarked that they were offensive and they pursued us down the street yelling that they did not have to accept our custom! Indeed they do not!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Cainha
Reviews.Content: Good 4 star hotel. The room was not big, but that is usually the case. Very clean, the room was cleaned 2 times a day. breakfast room is a bit small and was too crowded, but has a pretty view to a canal. Staff was friendly, the location is very good and we got weekend pack for great value.

HotelInfo.Name: Bella Venezia
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco - Calle dei Fabbri, 4710, 30124 Venice, Italy
